questions.question: What is the accounting equation?
questions.correct_answer: Assets = Liabilities + Equity

questions.question: Which of the following is a liability?
questions.correct_answer: Accounts Payable

questions.question: What does GAAP stand for?
questions.correct_answer: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a balance sheet?
options: To show a company’s revenue and expenses
To summarize a company’s financial position at a point in time
To calculate a company’s tax obligations
questions.correct_answer: To summarize a company’s financial position at a point in time

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a cash flow statement?
options: To show how much profit a company has made
To show the inflow and outflow of cash within a company
To show a company’s debt and liabilities
questions.correct_answer: To show the inflow and outflow of cash within a company

questions.question: Which of the following accounts is considered an asset?
questions.correct_answer: Accounts Receivable

questions.question: What is depreciation?
options: The process of writing off an asset’s value over time
The process of selling a company asset
The process of auditing a company’s assets
The process of increasing an asset’s value
questions.correct_answer: The process of writing off an asset’s value over time

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an operating expense?
questions.correct_answer: Rent expense

questions.question: What is accrual accounting?
options: Recording revenue when it is received
Recording expenses when they are paid
Recording transactions when they occur, regardless of cash movement
Recording income only when cash is collected
questions.correct_answer: Recording transactions when they occur, regardless of cash movement

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a sole proprietorship?
options: Owner has full control over business decisions
questions.correct_answer: Owner has full control over business decisions

questions.question: What is a trial balance used for?
options: To verify that all accounts have been correctly calculated
questions.correct_answer: To verify that all accounts have been correctly calculated

questions.question: Which account is increased by a debit?
questions.correct_answer: Assets

questions.question: Which of the following financial statements shows a company’s profitability over a period?
questions.correct_answer: Income Statement

questions.question: What is the main purpose of an income statement?
options: To report a company’s financial position
To show cash inflows and outflows
To summarize revenues and expenses over a period
To list company assets and liabilities
questions.correct_answer: To summarize revenues and expenses over a period

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a long-term liability?
questions.correct_answer: Loans Payable

questions.question: What is the purpose of financial accounting?
options: To record and summarize financial transactions
To track personal income and expenses
questions.correct_answer: To record and summarize financial transactions

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a current asset?
questions.correct_answer: Inventory

questions.question: What is an income statement used for?
options: To report a company’s financial position
To calculate the company’s tax obligations
To summarize the company’s revenues and expenses
To prepare for the year-end audit
questions.correct_answer: To summarize the company’s revenues and expenses

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an intangible asset?
questions.correct_answer: Goodwill

questions.question: Which of the following is true about accrual accounting?
options: Revenues are recognized only when cash is received
Expenses are recognized only when cash is paid
Revenues are recognized when earned, regardless of cash receipt
Expenses are recognized when cash is received
questions.correct_answer: Revenues are recognized when earned, regardless of cash receipt

questions.question: What is the correct sequence of steps in the accounting cycle?
questions.correct_answer: Journalizing, Posting, Adjusting, Financial Statements

questions.question: Which of the following is a common accounting principle?
questions.correct_answer: All of the above

questions.question: What is the definition of a liability?
options: An asset owned by the company
A financial obligation or debt owed by the company
A source of income for the company
A profit earned by the company
questions.correct_answer: A financial obligation or debt owed by the company

questions.question: Which of the following represents owner’s equity?
questions.correct_answer: Total assets minus total liabilities

questions.question: What is the role of an auditor?
options: To review and verify the accuracy of financial statements
questions.correct_answer: To review and verify the accuracy of financial statements

questions.question: What is an operating income?
options: Income from the sale of long-term assets
Income from the company’s core business operations
questions.correct_answer: Income from the company’s core business operations

questions.question: What is a dividend?
options: A type of bond issued by a company
A payment made to shareholders from a company’s profits
A type of loan a company receives
questions.correct_answer: A payment made to shareholders from a company’s profits

questions.question: What is a statement of changes in equity?
options: A report showing the company’s revenue and expenses
A report showing changes in a company’s equity accounts
A report summarizing a company’s liabilities
A report showing cash flow details
questions.correct_answer: A report showing changes in a company’s equity accounts

questions.question: What does liquidity refer to?
options: The ability to convert assets into cash quickly
The amount of equity a company has
The amount of debt a company has
questions.correct_answer: The ability to convert assets into cash quickly

questions.question: What is the purpose of internal controls in accounting?
options: To ensure compliance with legal requirements
To protect assets and ensure the accuracy of financial records
questions.correct_answer: To protect assets and ensure the accuracy of financial records
